answers.answer: I felt the same way!!!!!! My son is now 3 but i rememember that day. I felt like I was having morning sickness all over again. I did not have the shakes, but I was nauseated and vommited, and hot flashes. I think it is normal, at least that is what my Dr told me. What made it worse is I had to go back and take the 3 hr!!!!!!!!! Just lay down in a cool room with a damp cool wash cloth on your head and maybe take a nap if possible. I hope you feel better soon!

I never had any effects from it but it seems like anything and everything goes with pregnancy!!!  If it persists for more than just a few hours, I'd call your doctor....but otherwise, just try to rest and relax and I'll bet you'll be feeling better soon.  I hope so :-))
I had that too today and ended up puking in the parking lot! lol. I read the bottle while drinking it and it says it causes all that. That stuff tasted nasty!!!

I ended up calling the nurse and she laughed and said she had to take the test last year because she was sure that she failed because she felt so terrible afterwords... Turns out all of that sugar can make your regular blood sugar bottom out when it is leaving your system and can give you all of those terrible symptoms... I really thought I was having an episode! LOL!
i was fine afterwards...just super thirsty.....hoping you passed :)
I took phenergan before mine (they said I should) and didn't notice anything. But mine mighta been from the meds. I hope you feel better soon!!

I am so lucky I didn't have to drink that stuff. I got to eat 22 jelly bellys then go into the lab an hour later.I have heard alot of women get sick afterwards or even during the test And have to redo it. I would hate to have that happen.Hope you passed so you don't have to go through that again.

I felt fine during my whole test, and I failed, the one hour and the 2 hour I still felt fine and it came back borderline and am now seeing a diabetes specialist, so I am assuming everyone is affected differently!

nickie I felt light headed and a little shakey....i hope it's normal.  A friend of mine said that happened to her to and it was because her's turned out really low so I am hoping that's a good sign...did your dr. call with results?  It's been 2 weeks since my test and I haven't heard anything so I am hoping that is good....I guess maybe I should call since I don't have another OB appt. until August...

question: For all of the ladies here that have had the glucose test how did you feel afterwords? I am having a terrible shakes, heat flashes and feeling like I am going to throw up.... Is this normal?
title: Glucose test question
